taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek ptyx, folded, and sperma, seed, in reference to the ridged endocarp]

bio:treatment.discussion: This genus is popular in cultivation. Two species have sporadically naturalized sporadically in Dade County, Florida. The fruits are red and fleshy, and birds undoubtedly disperse the seeds.

references.reference: Zona, S. 1999. New perspectives on generic limits nd relationships in the Ptychospermatinae (Palmae: Arecoideae). Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 83: 255--263.
